register.description: This register contains the iVLCD revision code

bitfield.description: iVLCD Revision[3:0] Minor Revision[7:4] Major Revision

register.description: This register allows controlling various parameters of the OCP interface

bitfield.description: Read returns 0.Write has no effect (write a 0 for forward compatibility)
Clock activity during wake up mode period. 0 - OCP clock can be switched-off.
Read returns 0.Write has no effect (write a 0 for forward compatibility)
Slave interface power management, req/ack control '10' = Smart-idle. Acknowledgement to an idle request is given based on the internal activity of iME
read returns 0.write has no effect (write a 0 for forward compatibility)
Software reset. Set this bit to 1 to trigger the iME reset.The bit is automatically reset by the hardware. During reads, it always returns 0.
Internal OCP clock gating strategy: 0: OCP clock is free running 1: Automatic OCP clock-gating strategy is applied based on the OCP interface activity

register.description: The register provides status information about the module, excluding the interrupt information.

bitfield.description: Reserved for OCP socket status information.Read returns 0.
Internal reset monitoring 0 Internal module reset is on-going 1 Reset completed

register.description: CPU Status Register provides information about the progress of the CPU execution

bitfield.description: Execution States:00 = Initialized,10 = Executing,01 = Halted,11 = Completed.

register.description: Configuration Register

bitfield.description: Enable 2 byte swap for host OCP access to this memory. Bytes 0.1.2.3 are swapped to 1.0.3.2 for both reads and writes.0 - Disabled (Native order)1 - Swapped
Enable 4 byte swap for host OCP access to this memory. Bytes 0.1.2.3 are swapped to 3.2.1.0 for both reads and writes.0 - Disabled (Native order)1 - Swapped
QMEM ownership: 0: QMEM is owned by xVLCD1: QMEM is owned by HOST
HMEM ownership: 0: HMEM is owned by xVLCD1: HMEM is owned by HOST
IBUF1 ownership: 0: IBFU1 is owned by xVLCD1: IBFU1 is owned by HOST
IBUF0B ownership: 0: IBFU0B is owned by xVLCD1: IBFU0B is owned by HOST
IBUF0A ownership: 0: IBFU0A is owned by xVLCD1: IBFU0A is owned by HOST
Operation Type: Used to identify which start to issue to the xVLCD when a START command is set to the iVLCD.0 - VLCD1 - CAVLC
Interrupt Enable bit. Controls interrupt regardless of VLCD or CAVLC operation.

register.description: Initiate iVLCD operations

bitfield.description: Triggers iVLCD operations Reads of this register return the last command that was issued to the iVLCD

register.description: This register starts the VLCD and enables or disables the VLCD interrupt.

bitfield.description: Interrupt enable 0: Interrupt is disabled1: Interrupt is enabled
VLCD startRead0: VLCD idle1: VLCD busy.

register.description: This register sets the VLCD modes.

bitfield.description: Round control for the MPEG inverse quantization0: Round off1: Round on
Sets the number of blocksRange from 1 '001' to 6 '110'
Sets the JPEG Sync Insertion0: Off1: On. Inserts 0x00 after 0xFF.
Sets the MPEG picture coding type0: I, P, B picture1: D picture
MPEG4 escape encoding0: Escape3 only1: Escape 1, 2 and 3
Sets the macro block (MB) type0: Non intra macro block1: Intra macro block (JPEG uses only intra MB).
Sets the CODEC type for the VLCD operations000: JPEG001: MPEG1010: MPEG4011: H.263100 - 111: ReservedSee also[5:4] MPGMOD and [2] MP2ENCDEC .
Sets the quantization type use for encode and decode.Used in MPEG4.

register.description: This register sets the input address for the quantization computation.

bitfield.description: Sets the buffer used for the computation0: IMG BUF A/B1: IMG BUF1
Sets the start address for the computation

register.description: This register sets the output address for the quantization computation.

bitfield.description: Sets the buffer used for the computation0: IMG BUF A/B1: IMG BUF1
Sets the start address for the computation

register.description: This register sets the input address for the inverse quantization computation.

bitfield.description: Sets the buffer used for the computation0: IMG BUF A/B1: IMG BUF1
Sets the start address for the computation

register.description: This register sets the output address for the inverse quantization output address.

bitfield.description: Sets the buffer used for the computation0: IMG BUF A/B1: IMG BUF1
Sets the start address for the computation

register.description: This register sets the input address for the variable length coder and decoder operations.

bitfield.description: Sets the buffer used for the computation0: IMG BUF A/B1: IMG BUF1
Sets the start address for the computation

register.description: This register sets the output address for the variable length coder and decoder operations.

bitfield.description: Sets the buffer used for the computation0: IMG BUF A/B1: IMG BUF1
Sets the start address for the computation

register.description: This register sets the initial/final DC predictors for Quantization
This register sets the initial/final DC predictors for Quantization
This register sets the initial/final DC predictors for Quantization
This register sets the initial/final DC predictors for Quantization
This register sets the initial/final DC predictors for Quantization
This register sets the initial/final DC predictors for Quantization
This register sets the initial/final DC predictors for Inverse Quantization
This register sets the initial/final DC predictors for Inverse Quantization
This register sets the initial/final DC predictors for Inverse Quantization
This register sets the initial/final DC predictors for Inverse Quantization
This register sets the initial/final DC predictors for Inverse Quantization
This register sets the initial/final DC predictors for Inverse Quantization
This register sets the inverse quantization value used in MPEG.
This register sets the quantization value used in MPEG.
This register sets the delta value used in MPEG quantization
This register sets the delta value used in MPEG inverse quantization
This register sets the number of threads used in MPEG quantization
This register sets the coded block pattern (CBP) configuration.

bitfield.description: CBP detect enable0: CBP detect off (JPEG)1: CBP detect on

CBP indicating at least one nonzero in a block1XXXXX: CBP of the 1st blockX1XXXX: CBP of the 2nd blockXX1XXX: CBP of the 3rd blockXXX1XX: CBP of the 4th blockXXXX1X: CBP of the 5th blockXXXXX1: CBP of the 6th block

register.description: This register sets the luma bit vector

bitfield.description: Luma bit vector1XXXXXLuma bit of the 1st blockX1XXXXLuma bit of the 2nd blockXX1XXXLuma bit of the 3rd blockXXX1XXLuma bit of the 4th blockXXXX1XLuma bit of the 5th blockXXXXX1Luma bit of the 6th block

register.description: This register sets the base address for Huffman DC tables.

bitfield.description: Start address.Must be align on a 32-bit boundary

register.description: This register sets the base address for Huffman DC tables.

bitfield.description: Start address.Must be align on a 32-bit boundary

register.description: This register sets the base address for Huffman AC tables.

bitfield.description: Start address.Must be align on a 32-bit boundary

register.description: This register sets the base address for Huffman AC tables.

bitfield.description: Start address.Must be align on a 32-bit boundary

register.description: This register sets the base address for MPEG max level tables

bitfield.description: Start address.Must be align on a 32-bit boundary

register.description: This register sets the base address for MPEG max level tables

bitfield.description: Start address.Must be align on a 32-bit boundary

register.description: This register sets the base address of the control-table DC Y LUT used by the UVLD.

bitfield.description: Start address.Must be align on a 32-bit boundary

register.description: This register sets the base address of the control-table DC UV LUT used by the UVLD.

bitfield.description: Start address.Must be align on a 32-bit boundary

register.description: This register sets the base address of the control-table ACi LUT used by the UVLD.

bitfield.description: Start address.Must be align on a 32-bit boundary

register.description: This register sets the base address of the control-table ACi LUT used by the UVLD.

bitfield.description: Start address.Must be align on a 32-bit boundary

register.description: This register sets the offset value used to address the symbol-table DC Y LUT.
This register sets the offset value used to address the symbol-table DC UV LUT.
This register sets the offset value used to address the symbol-table ACi LUT.
This register sets the offset value used to address the symbol-table ACi LUT.
This register sets the base address of the symbol-table DC Y LUT.

bitfield.description: Start address.Must be align on a 32-bit boundary

register.description: This register sets the base address of the symbol-table DC UV LUT.

bitfield.description: Start address.Must be align on a 32-bit boundary

register.description: This register sets the base address of the symbol-table ACi UV LUT.

bitfield.description: Start address.Must be align on a 32-bit boundary

register.description: This register sets the base address of the symbol-table ACi UV LUT.

bitfield.description: Start address.Must be align on a 32-bit boundary

register.description: This register controls the VLD operations

bitfield.description: This bit signifies that the UVLD is expecting a 1 leadingHuffman table for the DC Y table.
This bit signifies that the UVLD is expecting a 1 leadingHuffman table for the DC UV table.
This bit signifies that the UVLD is expecting a 1 leadingHuffman table for the AC0 table.
This bit signifies that the UVLD is expecting a 1 leadingHuffman table for the AC1 table.
Decoded symbol bit length in DC Y table0: 12-bit symbol1: 11-bit symbol
Decoded symbol bit length in DC UV table0: 12-bit symbol1: 11-bit symbol
Decoded symbol bit length in AC0 table0: 12-bit symbol1: 11-bit symbol
Decoded symbol bit length in AC1 table0: 12-bit symbol1: 11-bit symbol

register.description: This register controls the UVLD operations for the DC terms

bitfield.description: Number of bits to test for the DC Y term as input to UVLD
Number of bits to test for the DC UV term as input to UVLD

register.description: This register controls the UVLD operations for the AC terms

bitfield.description: Number of bits to test for the AC0 term as input to UVLD
Number of bits to test for the AC1 term as input to UVLD

register.description: Number of valid bit pointer

bitfield.description: Number of valid bits in the 16-bit word pointed byVLCD_OUT.StartAddr or VLCD_IN.StartAddr

register.description: Bit stream
VLC byte align

bitfield.description: VLC: When set to '1' , it enable byte align in current processing macro blockVLD: When set to '1', it means current processing bitstream is byte aligned.
VLC: When byte-align is selected (ENABLE bit set to '1'), last byte is filled with this bit.VLD: No meaning

register.description: This register sets the base address for header data to be inserted.

bitfield.description: Base address for header data to be insertedMust be align on a 32-bit boundary

register.description: This register sets the number of header data to be inserted.

bitfield.description: Number of header data to be inserted1 to 1023

register.description: This register sets the Q/IQ config for block i

bitfield.description: Sets the scan mode (VLC/VLD)00 Linear scan01 Zig-Zag scan10 Alternate vertical scan11 Alternate horizontal scan
Inverse quantization matrix selector 1 of 8 banks

register.description: This register sets the Q/IQ config for block i

bitfield.description: Sets the scan mode (VLC/VLD)00 Linear scan01 Zig-Zag scan10 Alternate vertical scan11 Alternate horizontal scan
Inverse quantization matrix selector 1 of 8 banks

register.description: This register sets the Q/IQ config for block i

bitfield.description: Sets the scan mode (VLC/VLD)00 Linear scan01 Zig-Zag scan10 Alternate vertical scan11 Alternate horizontal scan
Inverse quantization matrix selector 1 of 8 banks

register.description: This register sets the Q/IQ config for block i

bitfield.description: Sets the scan mode (VLC/VLD)00 Linear scan01 Zig-Zag scan10 Alternate vertical scan11 Alternate horizontal scan
Inverse quantization matrix selector 1 of 8 banks

register.description: This register sets the Q/IQ config for block i

bitfield.description: Sets the scan mode (VLC/VLD)00 Linear scan01 Zig-Zag scan10 Alternate vertical scan11 Alternate horizontal scan
Inverse quantization matrix selector 1 of 8 banks

register.description: This register sets the Q/IQ config for block i

bitfield.description: Sets the scan mode (VLC/VLD)00 Linear scan01 Zig-Zag scan10 Alternate vertical scan11 Alternate horizontal scan
Inverse quantization matrix selector 1 of 8 banks

register.description: This register control the VLCD error enables.

bitfield.description: VLD error control. When JPEG or MPEG1/2 mode, thisbit should be set to 0 (off).0: Off1: On

register.description: This register reports VLCD errors

bitfield.description: VLD errorJPEG: Goes '1' when found FDX code at the end of MBH.263, MPEG4: Goes '1' when found an FLC error

register.description: This register sets the ring buffer start address.
This register sets the ring buffer end address.

bitfield.description: Ring buffer end addressVLC:When output pointer reaches the end address, pointer starts at start pointer automatically.VLD:When input pointer reaches the end address, pointer starts at start pointer automatically.

register.description: VLCD control register

bitfield.description: Endianism control0: Big endian1: Little endian
VLD algorithm selection0: Same as DM270 or before (all except MPEG4 RVLC, H.264, and WMV9)1: New algorithm for DM275 or after (must for MPEG4 RVLC, can also be used for others except H.264 and WMV9)
Additional MPEG mode0: MPEG4 normal1: MPEG4 data partitioning2: MPEG4 RVLC3: WMV9 (decode only) Field active when VLCD_MODE(5:4) = MPEG4
SCAN mode0: SCAN type is selected by VLCD_MODE(9:8)1: SCAN type is selected by Q/IQ_CONFIG1 to Q/IQ_CONFIG5
MPEG2 encode/decode0: MPEG1 VLCD_MODE(5:4) = MPEG11: MPEG2 VLCD_MODE(5:4) = MPEG1
MPEG4 escape encoding0: Escape3 only(DSC25)1: Escape1,2 and 3
Dynamic clock on/off control0: On 1: Off

register.description: This register sets the ring buffer end address.

bitfield.description: Sets the number of prefix bits of control table for theDCY term as input to the UVLD.
Sets the number of prefix bits of control table for theDCUV term as input to the UVLD.

register.description: This register sets the ring buffer end address.

bitfield.description: Sets the number of prefix bits of control table for theAC0 term as input to the UVLD.
Sets the number of prefix bits of control table for theAC1 term as input to the UVLD.

register.description: This register controls the WMV9 parameters

bitfield.description: Specifies the number of symbols in a block
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Setting this bit to '1' specify: PQUANT&gt;=8, I-Frame

register.description: This register specifies the first case of escape mode 3 in a frame

bitfield.description: Setting '1' specifies the first case of escape mode 3 in a frame, this register is cleared when found a ESCAPE3(WMV9)

register.description: This register configure H264 mode of operation

bitfield.description: 4×4, 4x8 subblock to 8x8 block conversionThis register is for H.264 and WMV9 .

bitenum.description: stores the data as 8x8 block image

bitfield.description: Setting 1 selects the H.264 SCAN table(IQ mode)
Setting 1 enable the H.264 CAVLC decoding

register.description: This register sets the threshold level of 'nrbits' (number of bits) in WMV9.

bitfield.description: Threshold level of 'nrbits' (number of bits) in WMV9 decoding.When the 'nrbits' gotten from the Huffman table is greater than this threshold value, UVLD error happens. Current VLD algorithm defines the maximum 'nrbits' is 6. No need to modify the default value.

register.description: CAVLC enable register

bitfield.description: Setting this bit will start CAVLC module. This bit is high while CAVLC module is running and cleared automatically after the completion of the job.

register.description: This register controls the macro-block type

bitfield.description: Set coded block pattern as the H.264 standard describes

register.description: This register sets the Ring Buffer Top Pointer

bitfield.description: Set Ring Buffer Top pointer in Image Buffer. The value must be even.If IBUF0 is selected in CAVLC_IBUFSEL, bit 12 select if IBUF0_A (0) or IBUF0_B (1) is used.

register.description: This register sets the Ring Buffer End Pointer

bitfield.description: Set Ring Buffer End pointer in Image Buffer. The value must be even. RBEND+1 will be the final word address of Ring Buffer. CAVLC_RBEND

register.description: This register sets the bitstream start pointer

bitfield.description: Set a pointer inside Ring Buffer from which bitstream will be written. After the completion, the final pointer is shown. Must be even number. If IBUF0 is selected in CAVLC_IBUFSEL, bit 12 select if IBUF0_A (0) or IBUF0_B (1) is used.

register.description: This register sets the number of valid MSBs in stream word registers.

bitfield.description: Set the number of valid MSBs in stream word registers. The bitstream to be generated follows the valid bits. It shows the number of valid MSBs in stream word registers after completion of the job.

register.description: Upper half of 32-bit Stream Word Register

bitfield.description: Upper half of 32-bit Stream Word Register. Write bits from MSB so that bitstream to be generated follows them. After the completion of the job, remaining bits, which is less than 32 and not written to Image Buffer, is shown.

register.description: Lower half of 32-bit Stream Word Register

bitfield.description: Lower half of 32-bit Stream Word Register. Write bits from MSB so that bitstream to be generated follows them. After the completion of the job, remaining bits, which is less than 32 and not written to Image Buffer, is shown.

register.description: This register sets Huffman memory read pointer

bitfield.description: Set a pointer in Huffman memory from which CAVLC will read pairs of an MB header symbol and its length, and pack the symbols into bitstream. Must be even number.

register.description: This register sets the number of MB header pairs to be inserted to bitstream

bitfield.description: Set the number of MB header pairs to be inserted to bitstream. The number is 0 to 1023.

register.description: This register sets Huffman memory write nA pointer

bitfield.description: Set a pointer in Huffman memory from which nAs are stored. Must be even. After the completion of the job, the number of coefficients of 4x4-blocks in the most right column will be stored from this pointer.

register.description: This register sets Huffman memory write nB pointer

bitfield.description: Set a pointer in Huffman memory from which nBs are stored. Must be even. After the completion of the job, the number of coefficients of 4x4-blocks in the lowest row will be stored from this pointer.

register.description: This register sets coefficients memory pointer

bitfield.description: Set a pointer in Image Buffer from which residual coefficients are stored. Must be even.If IBUF0 is selected in CAVLC_IBUFSEL, bit 12 select if IBUF0_A (0) or IBUF0_B (1) is used.

register.description: This register controls selects IBUF0 or IBUF1 and controls byte swapping

bitfield.description: Stream byte swap control bit.0: Normal1: Swap the two bytes in each 16-bit word.
Select input port,0: ibuf0 port,1: ibuf1 port.Input port and output port are allowed to be assigned to the same port.
Select output port,0: ibuf0 port,1: ibuf1 port.Input port and output port are allowed to be assigned to the same port.

register.description: number of bits generated

bitfield.description: Showing how many bits are generated in total. Automatically cleared when the job starts.
Showing how many bits are generated from MB headers. Automatically cleared when the job starts.

register.description: Showing how many bits are generated from residual coefficients. Automatically cleared when the job starts.

bitfield.description: Showing how many bits are generated from MB headers. Automatically cleared when the job starts.
